pullRequest.body:
While I find the time to actually fix the issue with parsing, this is a temporary solution for being able to use `@[stacks 0BR8]`.

[Reported on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/113488-general/topic/stacks.20tags/near/465660576)

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [356f99cc86](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16211/commits/356f99cc86413ca0d66b894ba4ee22ba654e04ab)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Could we get a test for this or would the test interfere with the data extraction we are planning to do in the future?

Ah, I meant to include a test.  It would not interfere with harvesting data, since it would be in the `test` folder, ~~but I'm no longer able to modify the PR for several hours~~and I have just pushed a test.

If someone else wants to add a test, something as simple as
```lean
@[stacks ¬´0B81¬ª]
example : True := .intro
```
would do.

If someone else wants to push this through, feel free to do so!
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

> Would you like to add a comment that this is a hack, and should be fixed properly? maintainer merge

Added a comment on the temporary fix.

#16230 is a "competing" PR that tries to implement a custom parser for the tags, rather than building it up from available parsers.  At most one of these two PRs should be merged, I think.  My preference would be to merge #16230 rather than this PR, assuming that #16230 does not have issues.

Would you like to add a comment that this is a hack, and should be fixed properly?
maintainer merge

Would you like to add a comment that this is a hack, and should be fixed properly?
maintainer merge

pullRequest.title: fix: hack for binary numbers in Stacks Tags

### PR summary [356f99cc86](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16211/commits/356f99cc86413ca0d66b894ba4ee22ba654e04ab)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Could we get a test for this or would the test interfere with the data extraction we are planning to do in the future?

Ah, I meant to include a test.  It would not interfere with harvesting data, since it would be in the `test` folder, ~~but I'm no longer able to modify the PR for several hours~~and I have just pushed a test.

If someone else wants to add a test, something as simple as
```lean
@[stacks ¬´0B81¬ª]
example : True := .intro
```
would do.

If someone else wants to push this through, feel free to do so!

Would you like to add a comment that this is a hack, and should be fixed properly?
maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.

> Would you like to add a comment that this is a hack, and should be fixed properly? maintainer merge

Added a comment on the temporary fix.

#16230 is a "competing" PR that tries to implement a custom parser for the tags, rather than building it up from available parsers.  At most one of these two PRs should be merged, I think.  My preference would be to merge #16230 rather than this PR, assuming that #16230 does not have issues.

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: parser for Stacks Project Tags
